so I've been wearing contacts for nearly
10 years now and I've always wondered
it's touching my eye every day doing
something bad to my eyes apparently
putting contacts in your eye is not a
neutral act according to microbiologist
Maria Gloria Dominguez Bello in fact
contacts might change more than just
your vision
Dominguez Bello and other researchers
from NYU Langone Medical Center found
significant differences in the
ecosystems of the eyes of people who
wear contact lenses and those who don't
in their study they took hundreds of
swabs of people's eye conjunctiva which
lines the eyelids and covers the white
part of your eyes and swabs of the skin
directly under the eye they found
thousands of different strains in the
different parts of the eye but in those
people who were contacts they had more
bacterial diversity in the skin beneath
their eye and a higher amount of
different kinds of bacteria on the
surface of the eye itself
they had three times the usual
proportion of certain bacteria like
methyl owe bacteria lactobacillus and
Pseudomonas bacteria in their eyes
basically the bacteria on the surface of
their eyes looked more like the types of
bacteria found on their skin when
compared to those who don't wear
contacts at all but the researchers
still wonder if this altered bacterial
composition is because contact wearers
keep touching their eyes but their dirty
little fingers or if it's the lens
itself that is changing the immune
system of the eye so more research is
needed there however the researchers
think this could be part of the reason
contact wearers get more frequent eye
infections since the 1970s when soft
contact lenses came on the scene corneal
ulcers have been on the rise corneal
ulcers leave a nasty open sore on the

contacts not letting the case air dry
and surprisingly and I'm a little

using a contact case and a solution from

you could try contacts coded with the
anti microbial stuff seriously
one study published in the journal
Optometry and vision science tested a
type of contact coated with melamine
this peptide fights microbes by
inhibiting their growth in this study
human volunteers worth these coated
contacts for a day with no major side
